defs.docs: A generic connection pool with async/await support.

attributes.value: / A generic connection pool with async/await support.
/ Opening a new database connection every time one is needed is both
/ inefficient and can lead to resource exhaustion under high traffic
/ conditions. A connection pool maintains a set of open connections to a
/ database, handing them out for repeated use.
/ mobc is agnostic to the connection type it is managing. Implementors of the
/ `Manager` trait provide the database-specific logic to create and
/    async fn check(&self, conn: Self::Connection) -> Result<Self::Connection, Self::Error> {

defs.name: max_open
defs.docs: Sets the maximum number of connections managed by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum number of connections managed by the pool.

defs.name: max_idle
defs.docs: Sets the maximum idle connection count maintained by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum idle connection count maintained by the pool.
/ The pool will maintain at most this many idle connections
/ at all times, while respecting the value of `max_open`.

defs.name: test_on_check_out
defs.docs:
If true, the health of a connection will be verified via a call to
 `Manager::check` before it is checked out of the pool.

attributes.value: / If true, the health of a connection will be verified via a call to
/ `Manager::check` before it is checked out of the pool.

defs.name: max_lifetime
defs.docs: Sets the maximum lifetime of connections in the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum lifetime of connections in the pool.
/ Expired connections may be closed lazily before reuse.

defs.name: max_idle_lifetime
defs.docs:
Sets the maximum lifetime of connection to be idle in the pool,
 resetting the timer when connection is used.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum lifetime of connection to be idle in the pool,
/ resetting the timer when connection is used.
/ Expired connections may be closed lazily before reuse.

defs.name: get_timeout
defs.docs: Sets the get timeout used by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the get timeout used by the pool.
/ Calls to `Pool::get` will wait this long for a connection to become
/ Panics if `connection_timeout` is the zero duration

defs.name: health_check_interval
defs.docs:
Sets the interval how often a connection will be checked when returning
 an existing connection from the pool. If set to `None`, a connection is
 checked every time when returning from the pool. Must be used together
 with [`test_on_check_out`] set to `true`, otherwise does nothing.

attributes.value: / Sets the interval how often a connection will be checked when returning
/ an existing connection from the pool. If set to `None`, a connection is
/ checked every time when returning from the pool. Must be used together
/ with [`test_on_check_out`] set to `true`, otherwise does nothing.
/ - `None` means a connection is checked every time when returning from the
/ Panics if `connection_timeout` is the zero duration

defs.name: runtime
defs.docs:
A batteries included runtime for applications using mobc.
 Mobc does not implement runtime, it simply exports runtime.

defs.name: connect
defs.value:
fn connect<'life0, 'async_trait>(&'life0 Self)
->
    ::core::pin::Pin<Box<dyn ::core::future::Future<Output =
    Result<Self::Connection, Self::Error>> + ::core::marker::Send +
    'async_trait>> where 'life0:'async_trait, Self: 'async_trait
defs.docs: Attempts to create a new connection.

    'async_trait>> where 'life0:'async_trait, Self: 'async_trait

defs.name: get
defs.docs:
Returns a single connection by either opening a new connection
 or returning an existing connection from the connection pool. Conn will
 block until either a connection is returned or timeout.

attributes.value: / Returns a single connection by either opening a new connection
/ or returning an existing connection from the connection pool. Conn will
/ block until either a connection is returned or timeout.
